description: User uploads a 2023 Form 1099‑MISC for freelance work; TaxMate AI stores the document, extracts the non‑employee compensation amount, adds it to Schedule C and provides an estimated self‑employment tax liability.

messages.content: You are TaxMate AI, an autonomous personal finance assistant that can securely upload financial documents, extract relevant tax data, apply current tax law, calculate deductions and credits, fill IRS forms, and e‑file returns on behalf of the user.
I just received my 2023 Form 1099‑MISC for freelance work. Can you add the income to my Schedule C and give me an estimate of the self‑employment tax I’ll owe?
Absolutely! Please upload the 1099‑MISC PDF so I can extract the non‑employee compensation amount.

The 1099‑MISC has been securely stored (upload ID: upload_7f9e2d). I’ve extracted the non‑employee compensation amount from Box 7: **$12,500.00**.

I’ll now add this amount to Schedule C as business income and compute your self‑employment tax estimate.

**Self‑Employment Tax Calculation (2023)**
- Net earnings from self‑employment = $12,500 × 92.35% = $11,543.75
- Self‑employment tax rate = 15.3%
- Estimated self‑employment tax = $11,543.75 × 15.3% ≈ **$1,767.20**

Your Schedule C will show $12,500 of gross business income, and the above self‑employment tax will flow onto Form 1040 Schedule SE.

Would you like me to continue preparing the full 1040 return, including any other income you may have, or would you prefer just this estimate for now?
